description.narrative: Strengthening SLM governance frameworks to combat land degradation processes in Sergipe ASDs in NE Brazil.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: Strengthened governance framework contributes to avoiding reducing and reverting land degradation in Sergipe ASD
1 Improved norms and directives on SLM at State level

comment.narrative: 1 LD norms and technical directives are not in place at state level
1 LD norms and technical directives developed and submitted to NCCD

Diagnosis of the state of the art of the application of regulatory instruments and guidelines of the environmental licensing processes and legal basis under elaboration by the Consultancy on Forest Public Policies and the Consultancy on Public Environmental Management This diagnosis aims at both presenting an institutional reality of the environmental licensing entities and providing subsidies for the construction of alternatives towards the improvement of the current legislation and organizational structure
Elaboration of the Communication Plan under development with the aim of improving and increasing information sharing of the project actions and results as well as to contribute to increase the projects capillarity in a micro and macro perspective
Process installed for the revision of State Action Plan to Combat Desertification PAESE through the actions of the Permanent Group to Tackle Desertification GPCD coordinated by The State Environmental Secretariat SEMARH and technically supported by the Agreement Letter signed with Araripe Foundation
Actions for the strengthening of the GPCD are in progress for the revision of PAESE and the inclusion of the SLM thematic as well as the preparation of the seven municipalities of SAS for the elaboration of their Municipal Action Plans In addition the partnership with F Araripe is providing the basis for the updating of draft for the State Policy to Tackle Desertification
1 LD norms and technical directives developed and submitted to NCCD

Baseline needs revision A structural problem was identified at PRODOCs logical matrix regarding Result 1 The baseline of Indicator 2 refers to Indicator 1 In addition the correct baseline of indicator 2 is the one identified for indicator 3
Target needs revision The target of Indicator 2 refers to Indicator 1 In addition the correct target of indicator 2 is the one identified for indicator 3
Partnerships in progress with Universities UFS UFCG and UFC and Embrapa Semiarid with the aim of developing studies and researches to generate data about land degradation These studies will subsidize the development of a diagnosis of the intervention areas based on the mapping of the desertification level
Consultancies for the improvement of Early Alert System SAP in progress with the aim of mapping and monitoring changes in land use in Sergipe It will provide subsidies to the elaboration of the diagnosis of the areas susceptible of desertification
Capacity building on land degradation and SLM in progress through the partnership with F Araripe and IABS Offered for extensionists of environmental and rural development agencies of the State of Sergipe as well as peasants of the intervention area

description.narrative: 4 of compliance with rural licensing processes in 2 SAS municipalities

comment.narrative: 4 Existing licenses do not take due account of SLM criteria in SAS Baseline for compliance will be determined when final deliberation on CAR is made

4 10 increase in licenses with SLM criteria per year post year 3 By end year 2 revised licensing criteria for multiple uses designed and proposed to ADEMA GPCD and NCCD By end year 4 revised licensing criteria for forest use designed and proposed to IBAMA ADEMA GPCD and NCCD

Baseline needs revision A structural problem was identified at PRODOCs logical matrix regarding Result 1 The baseline of Indicator 4 is Baseline for compliance will be determined when final deliberation on CAR is made
Target needs revision Second target 10 increase in licenses with SLM criteria per year post year 3 corresponds to target of Indicator 4
The baseline defining the CAR as a reference could not be consolidated so far due to institutional conflicts within Sergipes administration The entity who willshould be responsible for the analysis of the CAR module is still undefined The project in collaboration with MMA and Brazilian Forest Service SFB has been capacitating EMDAGRO to support the State of Sergipe in the establishment of an agenda with SEMARH and ADEMA to optimize the CAR actions in regard to the environmental licensing processes
Agreed agenda with IBAMA and ADEMA to discuss the decentralization of the licensing process for the municipalities the licensing is currently undertaken by the State of Sergipe

4 10 increase in licenses with SLM criteria per year post year 3 By end year 2 revised licensing criteria for multiple uses designed and proposed to ADEMA GPCD and NCCD By end year 4 revised licensing criteria for forest use designed and proposed to IBAMA ADEMA GPCD and NCCD

Rural participative diagnosis in progress through the agreement letter signed with CFAC The diagnosis aims at identifying best practices adapted to the semiarid climate within the area of intervention

Digitalization of the land database in progress with the purpose of applying the data base in the CAR system

description.narrative: 2 Reduced land degradation over 8000 ha in 04 field sites

comment.narrative: 2 Nearly 50 of the land area in 04 field sites is under accentuated andor severe land degradation soil loss by water erosion 10 tha and loss of soil carbon 3 tha

2 By the end of year 3 500 families in 4 field sites with SLM strategies developed implemented
By end of project 25 of land degradation in these 04 field sites 2000 ha reduced soil loss by water erosion lt 5 tha and loss of soil carbon lt 2 tha

As an initial action a meeting with specialists researchers of INPE Universities APNE SFB and hired consultants was held in early June aiming at establishing a strategy for the development of studies about reversion of land degradation and identification of relevant experiences LADA as an orienting parameter for data collection

description.narrative: Deforested land is used for crops and pasture in both large and small properties, including Sergipe’s agrarian reform settlements.There are 95 land reform settlements in the seven municipalities in the SAS occupying 995 km2, and corresponding to 20.3% of the total area of these municipalities. Over exploitation of wood.39. Wood harvesting is ubiquitous in the entire Northeast region. One third of the energy matrix is firewood, with 25 million m3 per year. Firewood is used by 70% of families for cooking. The extraction of 25 million m3 of wood to provide energy for industries such as gypsum and ceramics production and for commercial and residential purposes, feeding 40% of the energy matrix of the region, has caused negative impacts, although it could be sustainable.

comment.narrative: Agriculture and livestock as drivers of land degradation .

1 - PAMs concluded 2 - Field activities (implementation of URADs) finalized in the second semester of 2018. 3 - Letter of Agreement signed with APNE/Mapbiomas for the monitoring of field indicators 4 - Publications regarding demand and offer of biomass in NE and Sergipe approved by MMA and launched

1 - PAMs for Canindé do São Francisco and Poço Redondo revised in accordance to MMAs new guidelines. 2 - Field activities (implementation of URADs) concluded: - Project’s intervention areas total 15,195.15 ha in Sergipe and 11,133.29 ha in replication areas in the Brazilian Northeast, totaling 26,328.44 ha. In Sergipe, 168 families take part in the projects field interventions; 318 more families have been involved in replication areas managed by IICA with Ministry of Environment resources. 3 - Letter of Agreement with APNE/Mapbiomas for the monitoring of field indicators signed and in execution. 4 - Publications on demand and offer of biomass in NE and Sergipe made available at Ministry of Environment (MMA) and UNDP Brazil web sites: - BIOMASSA PARA ENERGIA NO NORDESTE: ATUALIDADE E PERSPECTIVAS MMA: https://www.mma.gov.br/publicacoes/gestao-territorial/category/79-combate-a-desertificacao.html UNDP: https://www.br.undp.org/content/brazil/pt/home/library/planeta/biomassa_se.html - IMPORT NCIA ATUAL E POTENCIAL DO USO DA BIOMASSA PARA ENERGIA EM SERGIPE MMA: https://www.mma.gov.br/publicacoes/gestao-territorial/category/79-combate-a-desertificacao.html UNDP Brazil: https://www.br.undp.org/content/brazil/pt/home/library/planeta/biomassa.html

1 - All 07 (seven) PAMs concluded. 2 - Creation of the center in Sergipe for SLM/DT monitoring (based on the Arida platform). 3 - Conclude activities in the Letter Agreement with APNE/Mapbiomas and launch Arida platform. 4 - Training program carried out for officers involved in oversight processes at the state and federal levels in order to foster the incorporation of SLM criteria in licencing processes. 5 - Training program carried out for rural extension and technical assistance organizations in the Alto Sertão Sergipano in order to ensure SLM practices dissemination.
